page.title: 03ECOLOGY,Yeoford area.
page.content: A{Geologist}came to our school and told us about the{Geology}and the plants in our area. There are lots of deciduous trees and not so many coniferous trees.On the north side of the{river Yeo}there is lots of redland but on the south side of the river{Yeo there is poorer ground.The{geologist brought three core samples. The first one was soil(redland). The redland is on the far side of the{river Yeo}and railway. The redland has good drainage and you can grow crops well. The second one was shillet(shale). It is almost like slate. It isn't very good for drainage and very crumbley. The third sample was also from this side of the river. It is hard clay and it is good for growing grass but bad for growing crops and clay doesn't drain very well. So the farmers have to work very hard on their land.
